title: Electrical Engineer Job at Kinetic Electromechanic Nigeria Limited
content:
Kinetic Electromechanic Nigeria Limited - We are a renowned Building, Industrial, Engineering and Facility Management Company in Port Harcourt, Rivers State Nigeria. We offer Engineering solutions in Mechanical, Electrical, Instrumentation and Plumbing to our esteemed client.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers - Site & Head Office (as required)
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Engineering
Reports To: Project Manager / MEP Coordinator

Job Purpose
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Candidate will oversee the planning, design, and execution of electrical systems in mechanical, piping, and process-driven projects.
	This includes supervision of site activities, ensuring electrical systems support fabrication, welding, and installation equipment, and ensuring compliance with standards, safety, and client specifications.


Responsibilities
Design & Engineering Support:


	Will develop and interpret electrical designs and layouts for equipment powering pipe fabrication, welding stations, HVAC, lighting, and instrumentation.
	Will design power distribution systems, grounding, cable routing, and panel schedules.
	Ensure integration of electrical systems with mechanical and process units.


Site Installation & Supervision:


	Supervise installation of electrical systems for
	Welding machines
	Heavy-duty equipment (grinders, cranes, compressors)
	Lighting and power points
	Control panels and junction boxes
	Ensure correct load distribution, safety interlocks, and proper earthing.


Project Planning & Execution:


	Prepare BOQs, technical specifications, and shop drawings.
	Support procurement team with technical input on electrical materials.
	Coordinate with piping, mechanical, and civil teams for sequencing and interfacing.


Testing, Commissioning & Maintenance:


	Perform loop checks, megger tests, and load trials on connected systems.
	Commission control systems for automated welding or fabrication machines.
	Maintain backup power systems (generators, UPS, etc.).


Documentation & Compliance:


	Develop and maintain method statements, risk assessments, and QA/QC documentation.
	Ensure adherence to Nigerian Electrical Code, IEE, IEC, or NEC standards.
	Liaise with consultants and client inspectors for approvals.


Qualifications & Experience


	Education: B.Sc./B.Eng. or HND in Electrical Engineering.
	Experience: 5 – 8 years in MEP, industrial fabrication, or construction projects.
	Certifications: COREN, NSE, or similar professional body is an advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of industrial electrical systems and controls.
	Familiar with electrical safety standards, permit-to-work systems, and lock-out/tag-out.
	Ability to read P&IDs and work with Instrumentation & Control teams.
	Proficient in AutoCAD, Revit MEP, and MS Excel.
	Effective leadership, problem-solving, and communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@kineticelectromechanic.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Internal Credit Control Job at Agricare STD Plus Limited
content:
Agricare STD Plus Limited is an agro allied company and sole distributor of standard agro-allied brands known for quality products. We have been in operation since 2006 and have contributed greatly to the success of many livestock farmers and other agro-allied establishments in Nigeria. We serve ourdiverse and unique clients all across Nigeria and beyond. With AGRICARE STD PLUS, business is more than just selling products, no matter the challenge, we focus on delivering practical and enduring results and equipping our customers with relevant information, products, and services that help them grow and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Credit Control

Job Location: Oyo
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	Ensuring an effective internal control environment through the development of adequate policies and procedures, debt recovery policies and procedures and ensuring their implementation and monitoring compliance.
	Designing, documenting, implementing, assessing, and monitoring the internal control framework, including policies and risks
	Ensuring that there are adequate controls to prevent errors or misstatements in financial reporting as well as ensure compliance with policies, operational and administrative processes
	Contribute towards establishing credible risk governance, an integrated risk management mindset, and an execution approach that prioritizes action based on business impact.


Job Responsibilities


	Perform and control the audit cycle that includes risk management and control management over operation effectiveness, financial reliability and compliance with all applicable regulations
	Debt recovery functions within and outside Nigeria.
	Determine internal audit scope and develop annual plans
	Obtain, analyse and evaluate accounting documentation, reports, data, flowcharts, etc.
	Review and approve transactions in line with laid down policies.
	Prepare and present reports that reflect the audit results and document the procedure
	Act as an objective source of independent advice to ensure validity, legality and goal achievements
	Identify loopholes and recommend risk aversion measures and cost savings
	Conduct regular audits to assess the adequacy and effectiveness of the control environment, including: Assessing and appraising the company's operational procedures and compliance with policies and regulations.
	Deliver adequate and timely reporting on the internal control framework and control framework and control deficiencies to ensure appropriate prompt communication, documentation, and reports to the Management teams.
	Implement adequate and timely action plans and monitor progress to address and resolve control deficiencies.
	Work collaboratively with various departments, functions or process owners to implement and monitor remediation effect efforts resulting in internal control assessments, ensuring implementations of corrective measure.
	Conduct special investigations of fraudulent malpractices across the organization.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3 - 6 years of work experience.
	Proven knowledge of auditing standards and procedures, laws, rules, and regulations
	Strong knowledge of implementing policies and SOPs
	Advanced computer skills in MS Office, accounting software –Sage 50
	Analytical skills to study problems, record and identify solutions.
	Competent interpersonal skills, demonstrating the ability to lead
	Proven knowledge of risk management and control.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications / CV to: recruit@agricareplus.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos

Responsibilities

title: Senior Golang Developer Job at Apex Network
content:
Apex Network is a Financial servicing firm, where anyone anywhere can easily and securely transact Bitcoin, which is the future of Money and a catalyst for creating and open financial system in Africa and the World.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Golang Developer

Job Location: Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full Time

Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are currently sourcing for a Senior Go Developer, as a Senior Go- Dev, you will lead the design and development of our core micro-services ecosystem.
	You’ll collaborate closely with our product, design, and QA teams to build resilient, high-performance APIs and services.
	Architect, build, and maintain backend services and APIs in Go (Golang)
	Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to ensure code quality
	Collaborate in code reviews, knowledge-sharing sessions, and technical discussions
	Design and implement microservices with strong focus on scalability and reliability
	Optimize performance, memory usage, and concurrency patterns
	Mentor and guide junior and mid-level engineers on Go best practices
	Participate in DevOps activities: CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes)


Requirements
These are knowledge, Experience and skill you must have :


	 5+ years of professional experience developing applications in Go
	Deep understanding of Go idioms, concurrency (goroutines, channels), and memory management
	Proven experience designing RESTful APIs and/or gRPC services
	Strong background with SQL and/or NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis)
	Hands-on with containerization tools (Docker) and orchestration platforms (Kubernetes)
	Solid understanding of version control (Git), agile workflows, and CI/CD pipelines
	Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
	Effective communication skills and a collaborative mindset.


The following will set you apart of from other candidates:


	Professional experience with Laravel or other PHP frameworks
	Background in the fintech or e-commerce domains
	Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
	Knowledge of event-driven architectures (Kafka, NATS)
	Experience with monitoring, logging, and tracing tools (Prometheus, Grafana, Jaeger)


Benefits


	Competitive salary
	Flexible working hours and remote?first culture
	Comprehensive health insurance package
	Collaborative and inclusive team environment
	Top Notch Work Tools
	13th Month Allowances
	Paid- Time Off
